NumberTile

Class Hand

  • java.lang.Object
    • NumberTile.Hand

  • public class Hand
extends java.lang.Object
    The Hand Class is the class for the hands within the game specifically. This Class constructs the hand and also is the way to access specific characteristics of the hand such as obtaining a tile at a specific index and also obtaining the size of the hand. The class that converts hands into strings.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Hand()
      Creates a new hand of 5 NumberTiles

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description

    • Constructor Detail

      • Hand

        public Hand()
        Creates a new hand of 5 NumberTiles

    • Method Detail

      • get

        public NumberTile get(int index)
        Get the NumberTile at the specified index in this Hand
        Parameters:
        index - Is the Parameter that tells the method which Tile within the hand the Caller of the method wants.
        Returns:
        The Method then moves onto Returning that specific Tile Similar to the Board get Method

      • getSize

        public int getSize()
        Get the number of tiles in this Hand
        Returns:
        Returns the Number of Tiles in the Hand in the form of an Integer That is tracked by our handSize Integer that Changes as we add and remove Tiles from the Hand. We implement the code for the change of the handSize within the Remove and Add Tile Methods within this class.

      • addTile

        public void addTile()
        Adds a new NumberTile to this Hand and also Increments the HandSize Integer in order to keep track of the Hand's Size

      • removeTile

        public void removeTile(int index)
        Remove the NumberTile at the specified index from this Hand
        Parameters:
        index - This Parameter indicates which specific tile within the hand to remove. For example if index = 0 it will remove the tile at index (0) of the hand. Since we are now doing Arrays I must implement a code within my remove Method that Pushes all the Tiles after the Specified Tile to be removed, Down one unit in order to cover for the empty space that is now there because of the Removal of Tile at the Specified Index within the Hand. handSize Counter is also Decremented to keep track of the Size of the Hand.

      • isEmpty

        public boolean isEmpty()
        This method check to see if this hand is empty. If the HandSize integer is equal to 0, the Boolean is set to true and vice versa for when it is not equal to 0
        Returns:
        True or False is Returned Depending on if the method finds the handSize to be empty or not. If empty, True is returned. If not, False.

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Return this Hand as a multi-line String.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        Returns the String Version of the Hand and if it is Empty, Returns an Appropriate String.
